Carousel

  • Usage guidelines
  • Basic Carousel
  • Light Carousel
  • Dark Carousel

Usage Guidelines

A carousel is a hero panel used to feature navigational links, typically in the form of eye-catching photos or graphics. A Carousel differs from a Billboard in that it can have multiple presentations that automatically rotate every ~4 seconds (depending on amount of content to visually comprehend) and also have paging controls that allow the user to manually advance or return to the previous; Billboards contain a single presentation.

Do

  • Use a carousel when you need to draw the user's attention to featured content
  • Use a carousel when there are at least two separate content blocks to display
  • Provide a call to action and link to another page, screen, or UI
  • Ensure carousel is visually appealing

Don't

  • Use a carousel when you have more than four content blocks to display
  • Link content to direct downloads or a command that is not part of the navigation
  • Use carousel on lower level pages (in most cases)

Basic Carousel

Carousels include left/right navigation controls, along with slide position indicators below.

First slide

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.

Learn More

Numero dos

Integer euismod laoreet diam at vulputate.

Learn More

Slide the third

Donec id magna vehicula, fermentum purus in, lacinia erat.

Learn More

Light Carousel

When you apply the .carousel-dark class to a carousel, the content and control colors are changed to improve legibility. This example includes inline styles to show how you can use CSS to apply a color overlay to a background image to further improve text color contrast.

First slide

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
